log.user: I agree with your claim that "Royal Couple could be a modern family." I believe it's important to clarify what is meant by a "modern family," which often refers to a family open to change and progression as opposed to sticking strictly to traditional norms. The reason you provided that "Kate and William appear to have a normal, modern relationship that does not seem to be threatened by outsiders" implies that they maintain an intimate relationship that parallels many non-royal, modern-day relationships. Their engagement in their children's lives, their work-life balance and the manner in which they navigate their public and private lives all amalgamate to make them significantly relatable as modern parents. Although they exist in an inherently traditional institution, they seem to embrace a lifestyle that aligns with the realities of many other families in society today. Therefore, I concur that a royal couple, specifically in this case, Kate and William, could represent a modern family.
